title: Wildfires Force Evacuation and Delay of Love Island: All Stars
summary: Filming for Love Island: All Stars has been postponed after the villa in South Africa was evacuated due to wildfires. ITV announced the delay, emphasizing that health and safety are their top priority, and the premiere, originally set for Monday, is now on hold. The wildfires are occurring in the Western Cape region, where authorities, including the South African Air Force, are working to control the incidents. Love Island: All Stars is a spin-off of the popular dating show, featuring former contestants like Jess Harding and Millie Court, hosted by Maya Jama, with an initial cast of 12. This disruption highlights the impact of natural disasters on entertainment production. Additionally, the article mentions past controversies from the regular Love Island series, such as viewer complaints about bullying and misogyny, though Ofcom did not investigate, and ITV provides training on respectful behavior. The delay may affect viewership and streaming numbers, which had seen growth in previous seasons.
